data.title: 60 things to do in Alabama over Memorial Day weekend
data.meta_description: What's your plan for Memorial Day weekend? Plenty of folks in Alabama will have their toes in the sand, their boats in the lake and their tongs in the backyard grill. But if you're not one of the beach-lake-barbecue crowd -- or if you're willing to get out of the lounge chair for a few hours -- plenty of events offer alternative entertainment throughout the state.
data.text:
(AL.com file photo)

What's your plan for Memorial Day weekend? Plenty of folks in Alabama will have their toes in the sand, their boats in the lake and their tongs in the backyard grill. But if you're not one of the beach-lake-barbecue crowd — or if you're willing to get out of the lounge chair for a few hours — plenty of events offer alternative entertainment throughout the state. Here are 60 of them, set for Friday through Monday, May 26-29, 2017. -- Mary Colurso

(AL.com file photo)

Pepsi Beach Ball Drop

What: Beach ball drop with 5,000 balls to celebrate the season, music by Blaire Hanks, children's activities and more.

When: May 26 at 5 p.m.

Where: The Wharf, 23101 Canal Road, Orange Beach.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.alwharf.com

(Courtesy photo)

Concerts on the Dock

What: Artists from Startlingly Fresh Records perform. With Kat Elizabeth, Rolling Jazz Revue, Raymond Williams, RatoBaby and more.

When: May 26 at 6 p.m.

Where: East Dock, Lowe Mill, 2211 Seminole Drive, Huntsville.

Admission: Free, $5 parking donation suggested.

Website: http://www.lowemill.net

(The Birmingham News file photo/Michelle Campbell)

Family Fun Friday

What: Warm-up and stretching, followed by team activity such as kickball, soccer or wiffle ball.

When: May 26 at 6 p.m.

Where: Railroad Park, 1600 First Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.railroadpark.org

(AL.com file photo/Michael Mercier)

Daikin Festival

What: Celebration of Japanese food, music, arts and culture.

When: May 26, 6:30 p.m.-9 p.m.

Where: Morgan County Fairgrounds, 2919 Fairground Road, Decatur.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://daikin-america.com/blog/2017/05/16/daikin-festival-2017/

(AL.com file photo)

Jubilee Pops Concert

What: Montgomery Symphony Orchestra performs.

When: May 26 at 7 p.m.

Where: On the lawn of Alabama Department of Archives and History, 624 Washington Ave., Montgomery. Bring blankets, lawn chairs and picnic baskets.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.montgomerysymphony.org/pops-concerts

(AL.com file photo)

Game Night

What: Board games for adults, part of After Hours @ the Plaza series.

When: May 26 at 7 p.m.

Where: Hoover Library, 200 Municipal Drive, Hoover.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.hooverlibrary.org/events

(Morgan James Facebook photo)

Morgan James

What: Soul singer and songwriter performs on her "Reckless Abandon" tour.

When: May 26 at 8 p.m.

Where: WorkPlay theater, 500 23rd St. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $15.

Website: https://www.workplay.com

(Epic Comedy Hour Facebook photo)

Epic Comedy Hour

What: Performances by Tevin Williams, Kayla Evans, Dexter Fugerson and more.

When: May 26 at 8 p.m.

Where: Flying Monkey Arts, Lowe Mill, 2211 Seminole Drive, Huntsville.

Admission: $8.

Website: http://www.lowemill.net

(Feetmac Wood Facebook photo)

Fleetmac Wood

What: Fleetwood Mac tribute act offers remixes of classic tunes.

When: May 26 at 9 p.m.

Where: Saturn, 200 41st St. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $15.

Website: http://www.saturnbirmingham.com

(Jelly Roll Facebook photo)

Jelly Roll

What: Nashville hip-hop artist performs, with YB and Stormie Leigh.

When: May 26 at 9:30 p.m.

Where: Zydeco, 2001 15th Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $8.

Website: http://zydecobirmingham.com

(HotBed Facebook photo)

HotBed

What: Psych-pop band performs, with Pink Pyramids, Heron and Crane, and Sister Sniffle.

When: May 26 at 10 p.m.

Where: The Nick, 2514 10th Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $6 advance, $8 day of show.

Website: http://www.thenickrocks.com

(Jacob Darrow Band Facebook photo)

Jacob Darrow Band

What: Rock band performs.

When: May 26 at 10:30 p.m.

Where: Green Bar, 2350 Fourth St., Tuscaloosa.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://greenbarttown.com

(AL.com file photo/Sharon Steinmann)

"To Kill a Mockingbird"

What: Stage adaptation of Harper Lee's novel, performed in historic former courthouse.

When: May 26-27 at 7 p.m.

Where: Monroe County Heritage Museum, 31 N. Alabama Ave., Monroeville.

Admission: $55.

Website: http://www.tokillamockingbird.com/the-play/

(Courtesy photo)

Fare Thee Well Acoustic Cafe

What: Music festival with Little Raine Band, Dread Clampitt, Becky Buller Band, Taylor Honeycutt and more.

When: May 26-27.

Where: On land owned by Steve Masterson, off Blount County 9, Hayden.

Admission: $60 advance, $75 at gate, $10 "down the hill" parking, $50 "up the hill" parking.

Website: http://theacousticcafe.com

(AL.com photo/Mike Kittrell)

Mobile BayBears vs. Birmingham Barons

What: Minor league baseball teams play in Southern League.

When: May 26-27 at 7:05 p.m., May 28 at 2:05 p.m.

Where: Hank Aaron Stadium, 755 Bolling Brothers Blvd, Mobile.

Admission: $7-$15.

Website: http://www.milb.com/schedule/index.jsp?sid=t417

(Coalfest Facebook photo)

Coalfest

What: Music, crafts, food, cornhole tournament, motorcycle ride, car and truck show, color run and more, celebrating town's mining history.

When: May 26-27.

Where: Various locations in downtown Brilliant, off Main Street and Old Highway 129.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://www.facebook.com/brilliantalabamacoalfest/

(South City Theatre Facebook photo)

"Our Town"

What: Thornton Wilder's classic play about small-town America.

When: May 26-27 at 7:30 p.m.

Where: South City Theatre, 2969 Pelham Parkway, Suite J, Pelham.

Admission: $13-$16.

Website: http://www.southcitytheatre.com

(Courtesy photo)

Steve Brown

What: Comedian performs.

When: May 26-28, five performances at various times.

Where: Comedy Club Stardome, 1818 Data Drive, Hoover.

Admission: $20.

Website: http://www.stardome.com

(Photo by Vasha Hunt | vhunt@al.com)

SEC Baseball Tournament

What: Southeastern Conference college teams compete for championship.

When: May 26-28.

Where: Hoover Metropolitan Stadium, 100 Ben Chapman Drive, Hoover.

Admission: $9-$72.

Website: http://www.secsports.com/article/11037437/championships-baseball

(AL.com file photo/Sharon Steinmann)

Mobicon

What: Comics, fantasy and sci-fi convention, with guest speakers, cosplay, movies, panel discussions, steampunk ball, vendor booths and more.

When: May 26-28.

Where: Renaissance Mobile Riverview Plaza Hotel, 64 S Water St., Mobile.

Admission: $22.50-$45 weekend, $10-$25 daily.

Website: http://www.mobilecomiccon.org

(Steward Edmonds photo/Red Mountain Theater Co. Facebook page)

"Dreamgirls"

What: Musical about a girl group that goes from obscurity to fame, inspired by story of the Supremes.

When: May 26 at 7:30 p.m., May 27 at 2 p.m. and 7:30 p.m., May 28 at 2 p.m.

Where: Red Mountain Theatre Co., Cabaret Theatre, 301 19th St. North, Birmingham.

Admission: $19-$40.

Website: http://redmountaintheatre.org

(Courtesy photo)

Dinosaur UpROAR Alive

What: Animatronic dinosaur exhibit, with fossil dig.

When: May 26-29, continues through Aug. 13.

Where: Huntsville Botanical Garden, 4747 Bob Wallace Ave. Southwest, Huntsville.

Admission: $8-$12, free admission for military personnel on May 29.

Website:http://hsvbg.org

(TruckStop Facebook photo)

Mary Colurso | mcolurso@al.com

TruckStop Festival

What: Food trucks, music, barbecue, brews, swap meet, vendors, children's activities and more.

When: May 26-29.

Where: TruckStop food truck and event park, 613 First Court North, Birmingham.

Admission: $10 daily at gate.

Website: https://www.facebook.com/birminghamfoodtruckpark/

(AL.com file photo)

Rocket City Fair

What: Carnival rides, games, food vendors, petting zoo, magic show and more.

When: May 26-29

Where: Joe W. Davis Stadium, 3125 Leeman Ferry Road Southwest, Huntsville.

Admission: $7, $5 for kids ages 5-12, free for those ages 4 and younger.

Website: http://www.rocketcityfair.com

(Photo by Tamika Moore | tmoore@al.com)

Alabama Splash Adventure

What: Water park and amusement park opens for the season with "wet and dry" rides.

When: May 26-29, open through Sept. 4

Where: Alabama Splash Adventure, 4599 Alabama Adventure Parkway, Bessemer.

Admission: $21.95-$29.95.

Website: http://www.alabamasplash.com

(Google Maps screenshot)

Geiger Day

What: Music, games, children's activities and more.

When: May 27.

Where: Outside Geiger Town Hall, 201 Broadway St., Emelle.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.sumteralchamber.com/event/geiger-day-3/

(AL.com file photo)

Memorial Day Weekend Festival

What: Music by Try Lewis, Kyle Kimbrell, Ben Myrick and more. With ice cream eating contest, tug of war, water balloon toss and more.

When: May 27, 8 a.m.-6 p.m.

Where: Smith Lake Park, 403 Cullman County 386, Cullman.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.cullmancountyparks.com

(AL.com file photo)

Quilt the Forest

What: Quilt block workshop with Michelle Reynolds, presented by Alabama Folklife Association.

When: May 27 at 9 a.m.

Where: Ruffner Mountain Nature Preserve, 1214 81st St. South Birmingham.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://ruffnermountain.org

(AL.com file photo)

Memorial Day Tribute

What: Guided tours and historical demos on military life from interpreters in U.S. Army uniforms from different eras.

When: May 27, 9 a.m.-3 p.m.

Where: Fort Morgan, 110 Alabama 180, Gulf Shores.

Admission: $4-$7, free for kids age 5 and younger.

Website: http://www.fort-morgan.org

(AL.com file photo)

Catfish Literary Festival

What:. Author talks, book signings, panel discussions, photography exhibit, music and more.

When: May 27 at 10 a.m.

Where: Athens-Limestone County Public Library, 306 S. Jefferson St., Athens.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://www.facebook.com/events/165812167248736/

(AL.com file photo)

Farmers Market

What: Local farmers, artisans and makers offer organic vegetables and fruits, handmade jams and jellies, cheeses and more.

When: May 27, 10 a.m.-2 p.m.

Where: East Parking Lot, Lowe Mill, 2211 Seminole Drive, Huntsville.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.lowemill.net

(AL.com file photo)

Downtown Dish Huntsville Food Tour

What: Walking tour with lunch tastings at several restaurants.

When: May 27, 11 a.m.-1:30 p.m.

Where: Leaves from Holmes Avenue and Greene Street, Huntsville.

Admission: $49.

Website: https://www.huntsvillefoodtours.com/tours/your-food-tour/

(AL.com file photo/Chip English)

LuLu Palooza

What: Music by Flow Tribe, Yellowhammer and Adam Holt.

When: May 27, 11 a.m.-9 p.m.

Where: LuLu's, 200 E. 25th Ave, Gulf Shores.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.lulubuffett.com/gulf-shores/

(The Birmingham News file photo/Beverly Taylor)

Day hike at Moss Rock Preserve

What: Southeastern Outings takes group on moderate 2- to 4-mile hike.

When: May 27 at 2 p.m.

Where: Moss Rock Preserve, 617 Preserve Parkway, Hoover. Meet at dirt parking lot off Preserve Parkway, near The Village Green in The Preserve subdivision.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.seoutings.org

(The Birmingham News file photo/Bernard Troncale)

"Brother Joseph and the Grotto"

What: Screening of documentary about Bavarian monk who built Ave Maria Grotto in Cullman.

When: May 27 at 2:30 p.m.

Where: Hoover Library, 200 Municipal Drive, Hoover.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.hooverlibrary.org/events

(AL.com file photo)

Salsa Showdown

What: Restaurants and catering companies offer samples of salsa, guacamole, queso and specialty dips, competing for awards. With music, children's activities and a hot pepper eating contest.

When: May 27, 2 p.m.-6 p.m.

Where: Cahaba Brewing Co., 4500 Fifth Ave. South, Building C, Birmingham.

Admission: $10 advance, $15 at gate, free for kids age 5 and younger. Benefit for Sidewalk Film Festival.

Website: https://www.facebook.com/salsashowdown/

(The Birmingham News file photo/Amy E. Voigt)

Contra Dance

What: Dance and concert organized by Birmingham Friends of Old-Time Music and Dance (FOOTMAD). Music by the Hickhoppers with caller Scott Russell.

When: May 27 at 7 p.m.

Where: Birmingham YWCA, 309 23rd St. North, Birmingham.

Admission: $4-$10, free for those age 12 and younger.

Website: http://www.footmadbirmingham.org

(Courtesy photo)

Alabama

What: Country-pop band performs, with Charlie Daniels Band.

When: May 27 at 8 p.m.

Where: Amphitheater at The Wharf, 23325 Amphitheater Drive, Orange Beach.

Admission: $42.50-$330 via Ticketmaster

Website: http://www.alwharf.com

(Audrina Taylor Facebook photo)

Loud & Proud: A Drag Extravaganza

What: Drag queens Kharris, Audrina Taylor, Yosemein Starr and Victoria Taylor perform.

When: May 27 at 9 p.m.

Where: Saturn, 200 41st St. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $10

Website: http://www.saturnbirmingham.com

(The Widdler Facebook photo)

The Widdler

What: Dubstep artist performs, with DMVU, Moglee and TripXud.

When: May 27 at 9:30 p.m.

Where: Zydeco, 2001 15th Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $12.

Website: http://zydecobirmingham.com

(Amacio Favor Facebook photo)

Amacio Favor

What: Rock and soul artist performs, with Zarinah & the Zaratans and Suzi Jones.

When: May 27 at 10 p.m.

Where: The Nick, 2514 10th Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $6.

Website: http://www.thenickrocks.com

(New Suede Facebook photo)

New Suede

What: Rock band performs.

When: May 27 at 10:30 p.m.

Where: Green Bar, 2350 Fourth St., Tuscaloosa.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://greenbarttown.com

(Photo by Bob Gathany | bgathany@al.com)

Alabama Jubilee Hot Air Balloon Classic

What: Festival with hot air balloons, arts and crafts, antique tractor show, live music, fireworks and more.

When: May 27-28.

Where: Point Mallard Park, 2901 Point Mallard Drive Southeast, Decatur.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.alabamajubilee.net

(AL.com file photo)

Art on the Lake

What: More than 40 artists and crafters display their works. Part of proceeds from sales benefits Children's Harbor.

When: May 27, 9 a.m.-5 p.m.; May 28, 9 a.m.-2 p.m.

Where: Children's Harbor, Lake Martin, 1 Our Children's Highway, Alexander City.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://childrensharbor.com/art-on-the-lake.php#.WR3VezOZPBI

(AL.com file photo)

Collectors and Shooters Gun Show

What: Gun Show organized by Collectors and Shooters company.

When: May 27-28

Where: Von Braun Center, South Hall, 700 Monroe St. Southwest, Huntsville.

Admission: $8.

Website: https://www.vonbrauncenter.com/event/collectors-shooters-gun-show/

(Courtesy photo)

Mudbugs & Music

What: Country artist Drake White performs, with Adam Hood, Dave Kennedy and Andy Citrin. Event includes crawfish, beer and cornhole.

When: May 28 at 5 p.m.

Where: Amphitheater at The Wharf, 23325 Amphitheater Drive, Orange Beach.

Admission: Free, donations suggested to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, $35 VIP via Ticketmaster.

Website: http://www.alwharf.com

(AL.com file photo)

Jazz in the Park

What: Saxophonist Elan Trotman and Clutch perform.

When: May 28 at 6 p.m.

Where: Huffman High School, 950 Springville Road, Birmingham.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://www.magiccitysmoothjazz.com

(AL.com file photo)

Out Loud HSV Poetry Slam

What: Poets perform in three-minute segments; audiences members judge their efforts until a winner is chosen.

When: May 28 at 6:30 p.m.

Where: Flying Monkey Arts, Lowe Mill, 2211 Seminole Drive, Huntsville.

Admission: Free, donations encouraged.

Website: http://www.lowemill.net

(Hot Rod Circuit Facebook photo)

Hot Rod Circuit

What: Indie rock band performs, with A New Kind of Hero and Bright Knives.

When: May 28 at 7:30 p.m.

Where: Saturn, 200 41st St. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $14 advance, $18 day of show.

Website: http://www.saturnbirmingham.com

(Rich Homie Quan Facebook photo)

Rich Homie Quan

What: Atlanta hip-hop artist performs.

When: May 28 at 9 p.m.

Where: WorkPlay theater, 500 23rd St. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $30 general admission, $60 VIP, $400-$600 booths.

Website: https://www.workplay.com

(DirtyGirl Facebook photo)

DirtyGirl

What: Funk-blues-rock band performs, with Natchez Tracers and Doc Holiday.

When: May 28 at 10 p.m.

Where: The Nick, 2514 10th Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $6.

Website: http://www.thenickrocks.com

(Photo by Bob Gathany | bgathany@al.com)

Cotton Row Run

What: 10K and 5K races, plus 1 mile fun run.

When: May 29 at 7 a.m.

Where: Centered outside Von Braun Center, 700 Monroe St. Southwest, Huntsville.

Admission: $40 registration for 5K or 10K, $15 for fun run.

Website: http://cottonrowrun.com

(AL.com file photo)

Memorial Day Observance

What: Wreath laying ceremony, music, flag placement ceremony, guest speakers, cannon salute and more.

When: May 29 at 9 a.m.

Where: Alabama National Cemetery, 3133 Alabama 119, Montevallo.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.scalnc.org/programs-alabama-national-cemetery.html

(AL.com file photo)

Memorial Day program

What: Ceremony with guest speakers, music, gun salute and more.

Where: Tuscaloosa Veterans Memorial Park, McFarland Boulevard East, near University Mall, Tuscaloosa.

When: May 29 at 9 a.m.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.tuscaloosaveteranspark.org

(American Village Facebook photo)

Memorial Day at American Village

What: Salutes to veterans, historical re-enactments and family-friendly activities.

When: May 29, 10:30 a.m.-3 p.m.

Where: American Village, 3727 Alabama 119, Montevallo.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.americanvillage.org

(AL.com file photo)

The Davis Little Expansion Project

What: Monday jam led by member of Little Raine Band.

When: May 29 at 6 p.m.

Where: WorkPlay bar, 500 23rd St. South, Birmingham.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://www.workplay.com

(AL.com file photo)

Monday Night Yoga

What: Beginner's Vinyasa Flow class.

When: May 29 at 6 p.m.

Where: Ruffner Mountain Nature Preserve, 1214 81st St. South Birmingham.

Admission: Donations welcome.

Website: https://ruffnermountain.org

(Jazzercise Facebook photo)

Jazzercise

What: Fitness program with dance and music, formats include strike, fusion, core, strength and more.

When: May 29 at 6 p.m.

Where: Railroad Park, 1600 First Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.railroadpark.org

(AL.com file photo)

Birmingham Bandstand

What: Open mic event.

When: May 29 at 8 p.m.

Where: The Nick, 2514 10th Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $3.

Website: http://www.thenickrocks.com

(AL.com file photo)

Bluegrass on the Plains

What: Music festival with Jerry Douglas' Earls of Leicester, Doyle Lawson & Quicksilver, Rhonda Vincent & the Rage and more.

When: May 29, festival continues through June 4.

Where: 3076 Alabama 14, Auburn.

Admission: $15-$125.

Website: http://www.bluegrassontheplains.com

(AL.com file photo)

Still more things to do:

23 summer movies you better see to beat the heat from 'Wonder Woman' to 'Baby Driver'

Listen to these 'songs of summer': From Prince to 'MMMBop' to Taylor Swift

Lake life: Try a tiny house rental at Lake Martin
